newsitem.title: UK: LPG sales from Norway's Karsto out for three weeks.
newsitem.headline: LPG sales from Norway's Karsto out for three weeks.

text.p: Norwegian state oil giant Statoil said its gas terminal at Karsto will be closed for three weeks due to a compressor failure.
"We will lose 40 percent of Karsto's production for three weeks", said a Statoil LPG trader on Monday. "The total loss will be 50,000 tonnes of propane and 28,000 tonnes of butane."

He added that the shutdown was likely to affect natural gas processing, "but Statoil is so long on gas that supplies can easily be met from elsewhere", and contract buyers were unlikely to notice any difference.
The problem was exacerbated because another of Karsto's three compressors was closed for maintenance at the time of Friday's breakdown.
Propane prices leapt on the news, with a large cargo sellling at $230 a tonne cif ARA on Friday, up around $20 from previously discussed levels.
